file_content.text: Welcome. So good to see you again.
As implied in our last, brief communication, Darth Arkous is at the center of a grand conspiracy.
Unfortunately, I have disturbing news. My suspicions about Darth Arkous's motivations on Tython and Korriban have been confirmed.
Arkous had the Jedi Temple raided to acquire knowledge of Rakata technology that he could use to harm the Empire. Even now, he plots against us.
Arkous is a fool to think he has the power to fight the Empire. This plot will end badly for him.
Then we'll stop him.
I agree, Lord Wrath, but we must remain vigilant all the same.
And he calls himself my equal? Darth Arkous tarnishes the entire Dark Council with this treachery.
He's pathetic and unworthy.
I know, Dark Lord--and for having played my part in serving him, I apologize.
There a price on his head yet, or what?
Does this make him a bounty?
This is still just between us, Hunter. No one else in the Empire knows what we do.
A secret conspiracy? I have some measure of expertise in that area.
This is right up my alley.
Yes, Commander. A blessing you're here. I'll admit I'm a bit out of my depth.
I know Arkous was a mentor to you. This can't be easy to take.
I hope you're okay.
He had me fooled for some time, but I see his true face now.
What can you tell me about this tech?
Nothing, I'm afraid. He smartly kept the details hidden from me, but we're very close to the truth now.
I've followed Arkous to a secure undersea laboratory here on Manaan, where he's working with a Selkath geneticist on... something. I've been trying to learn more.
I've also discovered that Colonel Darok secured passage to the same laboratory. He was behind the Republic's raid on Korriban.
It seems to me that Arkous and Darok are working together.
They're allies.
That's my feeling as well, but we won't know for certain unless we get into that laboratory.
Dark Council members make for attractive targets. This Darok might be ending the Arkous problem for us.
Darok may be after Arkous.
As you say, he's our problem, meaning we need to resolve it ourselves. We must confront Arkous in that laboratory.
I'm guessing you have a theory as to why.
What's your take on that?
I have a hunch. Until we learn what's happening inside the genetics lab, I'd rather not jump to conclusions.
As I said, it's a well-protected facility. You'll have to make your way through heavily armed Selkath and dismantle their security grid.
You're not coming?
I'd intended to confront Darth Arkous myself, but I sense a presence here--a potential ally.
I'll remain in touch and let you know how my search progresses. May the Force be at your service.
Welcome back. Once again, you've displayed a skill and determination that few possess.
I've seen worse.
Perhaps I should make proper introductions....
No need to tell me who I'm addressing. I'm Theron Shan--Republic SIS, and your new ally.
I don't think so.
Do not presume to choose who I align myself with, nor allow them to address me as their equal.
First Arkous starts working with a pawn of the Republic, and now you expect me to do the same?
We're supposed to go ahead and trust this guy? He's a spy. Said it himself.
So I'm to trust this man based on your word? He's a professional liar; I should know.
I fully understand your reluctance, but please--allow us to explain.
[Flirt] Care to defect, Shan?
If Lana vouches for you, I'll let that be enough--for now.
Strange, but... okay.
Fair enough, Sith.
Fair enough, bounty hunter.
Fair enough... Commander.
The way we were fooled by Darth Arkous--the same happened to Theron, except with the colonel.
And between what you found down in that lab, and what Lana and I pieced together, I can tell you they're both traitors.
Arkous and Darok are in league with a dangerous movement: a shadowy cult known as the Order of Revan.
The Order of Revan's no secret to me--I had a run-in with them on Dromund Kaas.
I know them.
In an earlier incarnation, perhaps. They seem to have grown strong, and bold. Very bold.
Secret or not, I feel I should've heard of this order.
Bring me up to speed.
They follow the teachings of Revan--a former Sith Lord who later became a Jedi knight, in case you didn't know.
Revan is no longer among the living. I made sure of that.
Revan's dead.
Every indication is that Revan died. Surely, he's not in control of the order that bears his name...?
Is Revan behind this?
It's not Revan himself, but those who follow his doctrine we're concerned with. They seem to have grown rather bold.
If they're a danger, they should be stamped out.
Let's destroy them.
You underestimate the devotion that Revan's life and teachings have inspired.
The Order of Revan used to operate in the shadows of Imperial space, but now their ranks include at least one major Republic figure.
That means I can't trust my people, and Lana can't trust hers--present company excluded. And if the Revanites are building an army of cyborgs....
I was about to send out a search party.
Sorry. I had to confirm some things before coming to see you.
As I suspected, the Order of Revan as it once existed is no more. A bit of a shame, really.
The Revanites' pragmatism may have been anathema to the Sith, but there was something appealing about it.
If the Emperor wanted a pragmatic Empire, that's how it would be.
Their ways are irrelevant.
Fair enough, but we are still capable of independent thought--even you, Wrath. But this is all pointless conjecture.
If the Revanites had their way, they would supplant the Dark Council, filling the Empire with feeble Jedi notions.
You speak heresy.
I did not mean to suggest I advocated your ouster, Dark Lord. Regardless, it's entirely academic.
Think I'd get more work from the Empire with the Revanites in charge, or less?
Whatever makes me money....
They would take less kindly to you, but only a little. Not that we'll ever find out.
I'd much rather do without mysterious enclaves and secret orders, thank you.
Cults make my job a pain.
They are good for job security, if nothing else. But if they get their way, you won't have a job.
You should know that I was made a Revanite.
They inducted me once.
After crossing Darth Arkous, I doubt your membership stands. Not that the Revanites of now resemble the group as you understood it.
Are you trying to tell me you see yourself as half Jedi?
How so?
I may not take a title, but I am Sith. I'm simply open to possibilities. The Revanites aren't one of them, though--not anymore.
Sign me up.
Not everything is so clear-cut as dark side or light side. They may be onto something.
Nothing wrong with being practically minded. Maybe they're not so bad.
I'm with you on the sentiment, but I wouldn't be so quick to subscribe to their ideologies.
The Order of Revan, as it stands now, doesn't wish to change the Empire from within. It aims to destroy us completely, and the Republic along with us.
I've not yet learned why or how, but Theron Shan might. He appears to be rather good at his job.
You're on the verge of giving me a complex. Are you suggesting Shan's better than me?
And I'm not?
I would never dream of it, Commander. I only mean to say that he'll make a fine ally.
I don't trust him.
I hope you know what you're doing, working with the enemy like this. An SIS operative, no less.
Guy's a Republic spy. We shouldn't take anything he says at face value.
After what Arkous has done--after betraying me, the Empire--I'm not eager to trust anyone. I still believe Theron Shan will make a fine ally.
With ears in both camps, we'll be better off against whatever threat the Revanites pose.
Teaming with him was smart.
I'm glad you feel that way. I admit I was concerned you wouldn't take to the idea.
Good at his job or not, he's not bad to look at.
He's quite attractive.
Yes, he does have a certain way about him....
If you say so. I've been too preoccupied by our state of affairs to notice.
Was there anything else you wanted to discuss?
The Wookiee smuggler and his droid--how do they fit in?
Will Jakarro be of use?
It's not entirely clear to me, but Jakarro will prove useful to us. That much I sense unmistakably.
What do we know about Colonel Darok?
Tell me about Darok.
Like Arkous, Darok held a great deal of sway. With the two of them combined, there's no telling how many are secretly working for them.
I should get to my investigation. Whatever Arkous's Revanites and their Infinite Army has in store for the galaxy, it can't be good.
May the Force ever serve you.
That time we spoke after reclaiming Korriban, I thought we shared something. A connection. Was I wrong?
[Flirt] What about us?
After what you just said about Theron Shan, I thought maybe you'd moved on. But no. You aren't wrong.
You also admitted an attraction to him.
I suspected you might be trying to tweak me. I suppose I tweaked back. No hard feelings, I hope.
You aren't wrong. I wasn't sure if I should bring it up now, but... I've missed you.
I think I'm starting to warm up to you, Lana.
[Flirt] Yes--you and me.
Is that right? You should know that the feeling's mutual.
I have to go now. There's much yet to uncover about the Revanites' plans--and the formation of this Infinite Army of theirs.
I'll be thinking of you.
If you'd like to join the Empire, I could put in a word.
You could always join the Empire. I think you'd make a welcome asset.
I'm oddly flattered. Not even going to consider it, of course, but flattered.
I do not care about any of this! I want revenge on the Pub and the Imp who left me to die--twice!
This is Jakarro.
And I am Ceetoo Deefour, former translator to Her Imminence, Queen Lina of Onderon.
Hey, Jakarro--how would you feel about helping me track those two down?
I can help. I have many contacts all over the galaxy. But I do the driving!
We'll talk about it. Lana, will you be joining us?
We don't yet know how deep the Revanites' influence runs. I must learn what I can from within the Empire.
You've done well here, as expected. We'll speak again soon.
Rakata technology?
What can you tell me about this technology?
Our work here is done.
May the Force ever serve you.
We cannot let Darth Arkous pursue his betrayal of the Empire.
